column4: I have an e-sata drive that will not be auto-recognized by linux unless it is connected prior to the computer being started, is there a command to force linux to check for new devices and register any changes as a result of that check?
it all depends on your motherboard i'm afraid - mine doesn't support hot-plugging esata either :(  some do.
it does support hot swapping sata but it does not register in linux
run dmesg, plug the drive in/turn in on - then run dmesg again - do you see anything about sdX added?
